issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: On eucalyptus, default device in attach volume dialog should be changed  to /dev/vdc (instead of /dev/sdf) . /dev/sdf is the correct default for AWS, but it will fail on eucalyptus cloud with hvm images.
fields.summary: Change default device to /dev/vdc in attach volume dialog on eucalyptus

comments.body:
In the past, we always specified /dev/sd*, but it would just be mapped to something else on the instance (like /dev/vd*). Is this no longer the case?
Looking at the EBS docs: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ebs-attaching-volume.html

It isn't clear that we ought to default to one or another. Is it possible to tell if it's and HVM vs ParaVirt image?
When "Attach volume" dialog is called from volumes landing page on Euca, the default is still /dev/sdf
[~alice], that's just the placeholder text. When you select an instance, it generates the suggested device based on what's already attached and that is when you get the /dev/vdc.
[~dkavanagh] can we update the placeholder to show /dev/vdc? To me as a user the default suddenly changing is weird from UX perspective. [~jloza] what do you think?
FYI, the default shows correctly when the attach dialog is called from instaces detail page.
[~dkavanagh], [~alice]: If we supply a default, there shouldn't be placeholder text at all, the default value should just be prepopulated in the box.

[~jloza], I want to point out that in the case of attaching from a volumes page, we don't know the instance till the user selects it. Once they select the instance, we can determine the best suggestion for a device (based on what's already attached). So, the device field would appear empty till then if we don't have a placeholder.
We could set a placeholder based on cloud-type, but initially I didn't think it necessary. I'm open to suggestions.
[~dkavanagh] in that case, it's best to be blank if we will subsequently populate it for the user.
[~dkavanagh], [~jloza] Yes, leaving it blank is ok with me.
PR 1224 is missing removal of the '/dev/sdf' placeholder in instance_volumes.pt
The user never sees that since the suggested device is immediately populated.
